text.tspan: We can divide the prolog rules into 3 categories:
(1) the rules from the main_loop written for the
display of the information retrieved by the text,
(2) set of rules which works using list and recursion
and (3) a group of rules able to discover new knowledge.
In order to present the information in a meaningful
and structured way, a set of rules whose main
objective is to retrieve the knowledge and display
it to the user have been created.
The result of these rules can be accessed using the
main_loop rules which can be activated and bring
the state of the program in an infinite loop unless
'Do you want to start again? y/n : '
is consulted the list of persons and
organizations are printed to the screen and the
possibility to choose an element in the list is given.
When the user writes a valid string the rule
choose_loop/1 calls the set of rules specific to an
organization or a person depending on the element
